title: Comparative Analysis and Application of Activities for University Mathematics Learning Preparation

context.prior_knowledge: Middle school-level mathematical foundations (equations, functions, geometric concepts)
context.additional_context: VR Simulation-Based Situated Learning Environment for Enhancing Math Instructional Competencies of In-Service Secondary School Teachers

learning_goals: Learners can explain the core principles of productive failure, contrastive learning, meaning-making, and worked examples and select them contextually
Learners can compare and analyze the effectiveness of four learning readiness activities through VR-based simulations and apply them to educational settings
Based on formative assessment results, learners can select the most suitable readiness activities for their instructional design and create lesson plans

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
